intro: Hedyotis acuminata f. grayana, commonly known as the grayana honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant features small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly serrated margin. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
